main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 7th June 1949 in Springfield, Mass. The object appeared to be white, spherical and of metallic construction, and was observed flying horizontally before abruptly ascending vertically and then returning to its former position.
interesting points: The observer described the object as being about the size of a jet plane, but without wings, and traveling at a speed of 400-500 miles per hour
The object was observed at an extremely high altitude, making it difficult to ascertain its exact size
No evidence of exhaust, visible lights, wings, or other visible support was noted, although the object could have been a rotating cylinder of some type
The observer, a writer, was described as having an excellent character and high degree of intelligence, making the report more credible
Weather balloon attachments for radiosonde in the area could have accounted for the sighting according to information provided on the report
witnesses: Described as having a high degree of intelligence, fair observer
